SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.socket

Class ClientSocket

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.socket.ClientSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetworkClient, Runnable
public class ClientSocket extends Object implements Runnable, NetworkClient
The ClientSocket class implements the NetworkClient interface and provides the functionality for a client to communicate with a server over a socket connection. It defines methods for game actions such as login, choosing color, drawing cards etc., and sends these actions to the server. It also handles responses from the server and updates the client's view accordingly.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientSocket

      public ClientSocket(Controller controller, String address, int port) throws IOException
      Creates a new ClientSocket with the given controller, address, and port. It establishes a socket connection to the server and initializes input and output streams for communication.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller that manages the client's view and game logic.
      address - The address of the server.
      port - The port of the server.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the socket or the input/output streams.

  • Method Details

    • login

      public void login(String nickname)
      NetworkClient implementation Logs in the player with the given nickname. This method is used to authenticate a player in the game.
      Specified by:
      login in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

      public void insertNumberOfPlayers(int numberOfPlayers)

      Specified by:
      insertNumberOfPlayers in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - The number of players.

    • chooseColor

      public void chooseColor(Color color)
      NetworkClient implementation Chooses the color for the player. This method is used to set the color of the player in the game.

      chooseColor in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      color - The color chosen by the player.

    • sendChatMessage

      public void sendChatMessage(String sender, String message)
      NetworkClient implementation Sends a chat message. This method is used to send a chat message to the other players in the game.
      Specified by:
      sendChatMessage in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      sender - The nickname of the player who sent the message.
      message - The message sent by the player.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(int indexHand, Point position, boolean side)
      NetworkClient implementation Plays a card from the player's hand. This method is used to play a card from the player's hand onto the game table. It takes three parameters: the index of the card in the player's hand, the position on the table where the card will be placed, and the side of the card.
      Specified by:
      playCard in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      indexHand - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      position - The position on the table where the card will be placed.
      side - The side of the card.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(String nickname, boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck)
      NetworkClient implementation Draws a card for the player. This method is used to draw a card for the player. It takes three parameters: the nickname of the player, a boolean indicating whether the card is gold, and an integer indicating whether the card is drawn from the table or the deck(-1 deck, o or 1 for table).
      Specified by:
      drawCard in interface NetworkClient
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      gold - A boolean indicating whether the card is gold.
      onTableOrDeck - An integer indicating whether the card is drawn from the table or the deck.

    • run

      public void run()
      The run method is the entry point for the thread that handles communication with the server. It continuously receives messages from the server and handles them accordingly.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • handleResponse

      public void handleResponse(ServerMessage message)
      Handles the response from the server. This method is called by the run method for each received server message. It calls the appropriate method on the controller based on the type of the server message.
      Parameters:
      message - The server message to be handled.

    • receiveMessage

      public ServerMessage receiveMessage() throws IOException
      Receives a message from the server. This method is called by the run method to receive a server message. It blocks until a message is received or an error occurs.
      Returns:
      The received server message.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while receiving the message.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Closes the input and output streams and the socket connection to the server. If an I/O error occurs while closing the streams or the connection, it calls the `noConnection` method on the controller.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(ClientMessage message)
      Sends a message to the server. This method is used to send a message to the server over the socket connection. It takes a Message object as a parameter, which is serialized and sent over the connection.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be sent to the server.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs while sending the message.
